title.en: Plastic has been detected on the surface of all oceans
title.de: Plastik wurde in allen Ozeanen gefunden

description.en: Plastic in the ocean is a threat to marine wildlife and can enter the global food chains. This map shows the modelled plastic concentration based on measurements from 24 expeditions. Darker colours indicate more plastic waste.
description.de: Plastic in the ocean is a threat to marine wildlife as well as seafood consumers. This map shows the modelled plastic concentration based on measurements from 24 expeditions. Darker colours indicate more plastic waste.

title.en: Poor waste management is a major source of plastic debris
title.de: Poor waste management is a major source of plastic debris

description.en: This map layer shows estimates of mismanaged plastic waste per km2, that were derived using population data and GDP. Darker colours indicate higher amounts of mismanaged waste that can enter our environment.
description.de: This map layer shows an estimate of mismanaged plastic waste that can enter the environment based on population data and GDP. Darker colours indicate higher amounts of mismanaged waste.

title.en: Rivers carry plastic from land to sea
title.de: Rivers carry plastic from land to sea

description.en: Wind and rain carry plastic waste into our streams and rivers. This layer shows the estimated amount of plastic waste entering our oceans through rivers based on waste management, population density and river information.
description.de: Wind and rain carry plastic waste into our streams and rivers. This layer shows the estimated amount of plastic waste entering our oceans through rivers based on waste management, population density and river information.

description.en: Plastic and other floating debris are moved by winds and ocean currents und eventually accumulate at the center of large current systems called gyres.
description.de: Plastic and other floating debris are moved by winds and ocean currents und eventually accumulate at the center of large current systems called gyres.
